cap:
Morning in the forest.
Sunlight slips through the leaves, making the ground sparkle.
In the distance, the outline of a white mountain can be faintly seen.

Risuko "Suzuko, what are you looking at?"
Suzuko "Look, look. The line of the mountain is glowing white..."

Suzuko suddenly jumped up and ran over to Risuko.

Suzuko "Risuko! Let's go all the way up that mountain.
I'm sure we'll see an amazing view!"
Risuko "Huh?"

The mountain was quiet and enormous.
Once you looked at it, it was hard to look away.

Suzuko "You know, there was a mountain I saw in a picture book.
The sun was rising between the peaks,
and it was so, so beautiful...
I never forgot it.
Now that we're here, I really want to see it up close!"

Risuko "That look on your face, Suzuko.
You won't be satisfied unless we go closer."

Their footsteps grew louder, and the forest became a little livelier.
When they looked up, the mountain loomed right in front of them.

Suzuko "It's huge...!
It's really huge when you see it up close!"
Risuko "You said that twice."

Water rushed past with a sharp whooshing sound.
Its cold voice ran around their feet.

Suzuko "This sound is so cool!
It's cold, but full of energy!"
Risuko "Yeah. It's like the water is running."

Something in the stream glittered brightly.
The water was so clear they could see the shapes of the stones.

Suzuko "Mountain water is this clear..."
Risuko "It really is. It's sparkling!"

Even as the path grew narrower, it kept going forward.
The sky slowly began to feel wider.

Suzuko "Hey, look!
We're almost at the foot of the mountain!"
Risuko "Alright, let's go!"

Suddenly, the view opened up.
White light spread out, and they instinctively squinted.

Suzuko "Wow...
Look! You can see so far!"
Risuko "Yeah. It feels like my chest is clearing."

In the shade of a rock, there was a small feeding spot.
Birds gathered quietly, eating their meal.

Suzuko "Oh... food.
The birds look so calm while they eat."
Risuko "They're hopping around. So cute."

In the white snow, a soft shadow.
A white fox was curled up, sleeping.

Suzuko "A white fox...!
It really exists..."
Risuko "It looks so fluffy and cozy."

They quietly left the spot and started walking again.
The snowy path continued upward.

Suzuko "The snowy steps feel so soft!"
Risuko "Let's count as we go.
One, two, three!"

Being on the trees looked more fun than walking on the snow.
Once that thought appeared, it had already begun.

Risuko "See? Tree route!"
Suzuko "It's slippery, but fun!"

From up high, the forest looked a little wider than usual.

Suzuko "Careful not to fall. Slowly."
Risuko "It's okay. I'm used to it!"

The path was slanted.
But somehow, that made it fun.

Risuko "This angle is just right!"
Suzuko "Yeah! Straight paths are boring!"

Snowy paths are slippery.
But that wasn't a reason to stop.

Risuko "I'm getting faster!"
Suzuko "The snow is cheering us on!"

Compared to the snow, the branches seemed easier to move on.

Risuko "Look, the path is this way."
Suzuko "You're right. A branch path!"

Risuko "It really keeps going."
Suzuko "Mountains are kind, aren't they?"

In the distance, the mountain came into view.
That alone made their steps feel lighter.

Risuko "That's it, right?"
Suzuko "Yeah, it's right there!"
Risuko "If we run, we'll be there in no time!"
Suzuko "Then full speed!"

They checked their footing and met each other's eyes.
Ahead of them, the same景色 awaited.

Risuko "It's close."
Suzuko "Yeah. Almost there."

Stairs continued upward.
The sound of crunching snow became a pleasant rhythm.

Risuko "Hah... but we can't stop."
Suzuko "We've come this far!"

They stood at the highest point.
The wind was cold, but refreshing.
They were happy they had made it this far.

In front of them,
a white, open world was waiting.

Risuko "We made it...!"
Suzuko "Wow... what an amazing view...!"

At the top of the mountain, they stopped.
A time when they didn't need to run.

Risuko "We made it."
Suzuko "Yeah. Let's rest a bit."

A small bird fluttered over nearby.

Risuko "Oh, look. A bird."
Suzuko "You're right. Maybe a rest buddy."

Warm drinks loosened their bodies.

Risuko "Ah... so warm."
Suzuko "After climbing, it tastes extra good."

Risuko "It really sinks into tired bodies."
Suzuko "It tastes like hard work."

They shared some bread and ate slowly.

Risuko "Food tastes better outside."
Suzuko "Even though it's the same bread."

Risuko "The place is the real treat."
Suzuko "I get that."

They remembered what had happened a little earlier.

Risuko "That branch earlier was fun."
Suzuko "It wasn't really a path, though."

Risuko "But we made it through."
Suzuko "Yeah, we kept going."

The snowy forest was quiet.

Risuko "There aren't many sounds."
Suzuko "That makes it calming."

Risuko "It makes me think."
Suzuko "Feels like a real break."

Thinking about going back made it a little hard to leave.

Risuko "Can we stay a bit longer?"
Suzuko "Yeah. Just a little."

Risuko "Then just a little more."
Suzuko "Yeah."

Watching the fire made time slow down.

Risuko "I want to come back here."
Suzuko "Yeah. Let's climb again."

Risuko "Next time, more slowly."
Suzuko "With more breaks."

The snow kept falling.
But today was enough.

Risuko "It was a good day."
Suzuko "Yeah. It was fun."

The color of the sky slowly began to change.
It was evening.

Risuko "...The sky is beautiful."
Suzuko "It really is. It just changed."

Risuko "A color you can only see now."
Suzuko "Yeah. We should hurry."

They quickened their pace just a little.
The trees opened up, and the view spread wide.

Risuko "Wow...!"
Suzuko "Amazing...!"

The sun slowly sank behind the mountains.
Snow, trees, and their shadows were dyed the same color.

...

Risuko "..."
Suzuko "..."

No words were needed.

Risuko "...It's beautiful."
Suzuko "Yeah... truly."

After a while, they let out small breaths.

Risuko "It's getting a little cold."
Suzuko "It's evening, after all."

Risuko "But I'm glad we saw it."
Suzuko "Yeah."

The sun began to sink behind the mountains,
and the colors of the sky slowly shifted.
The liveliness from before naturally faded.

Suzuko "...It's beautiful.
I'm glad we came all this way today."

In the cold air,
only their footsteps remained in the snow.
They would never forget this view.

Risuko "Yeah. Let's come again."
